Path: app/src/main/java/com/nauh/musicplayer/service/MusicServiceConnection.kt
 1	package com.nauh.musicplayer.service
 2	
 3	import android.content.ComponentName
 4	import android.content.Context
 5	import android.content.Intent
 6	import android.content.ServiceConnection
 7	import android.os.IBinder
 8	import android.util.Log
 9	import androidx.media3.common.MediaItem
 10	import androidx.media3.common.Player
 11	import androidx.media3.session.MediaController
 12	import androidx.media3.session.SessionToken
 13	import com.google.common.util.concurrent.ListenableFuture
 14	import com.google.common.util.concurrent.MoreExecutors
 15	import com.nauh.musicplayer.data.model.Song
 16	
 17	/**
 18	 * Service connection class to manage communication between UI and MusicService
 19	 * Handles MediaController setup and provides playback control methods
 20	 */
 21	class MusicServiceConnection(private val context: Context) {
 22	
 23	 private var mediaControllerFuture: ListenableFuture<MediaController>? = null
 24	 private var mediaController: MediaController? = null
 25	 private var playbackStateListener: PlaybackStateListener? = null
 26	
 27	 companion object {
 28	 private const val TAG = "MusicServiceConnection"
 29	 }
 30	 
 31	 interface PlaybackStateListener {
 32	 fun onPlaybackStateChanged(isPlaying: Boolean)
 33	 fun onProgressUpdate(position: Long, duration: Long)
 34	 fun onSongChanged(song: Song?)
 35	 }
 36	 
 37	 fun setPlaybackStateListener(listener: PlaybackStateListener) {
 38	 this.playbackStateListener = listener
 39	 }
 40	 
 41	 fun connect() {
 42	 Log.d(TAG, "Connecting to MusicService...")
 43	 // Start the service first to ensure it's running
 44	 val serviceIntent = Intent(context, MusicService::class.java)
 45	 context.startService(serviceIntent)
 46	
 47	 val sessionToken = SessionToken(context, ComponentName(context, MusicService::class.java))
 48	 mediaControllerFuture = MediaController.Builder(context, sessionToken).buildAsync()
 49	
 50	 mediaControllerFuture?.addListener({
 51	 try {
 52	 mediaController = mediaControllerFuture?.get()
 53	 Log.d(TAG, "MediaController connected successfully")
 54	 mediaController?.addListener(object : Player.Listener {
 55	 override fun onPlaybackStateChanged(playbackState: Int) {
 56	 val isPlaying = mediaController?.isPlaying ?: false
 57	 playbackStateListener?.onPlaybackStateChanged(isPlaying)
 58	 }
 59	
 60	 override fun onIsPlayingChanged(isPlaying: Boolean) {
 61	 playbackStateListener?.onPlaybackStateChanged(isPlaying)
 62	 }
 63	
 64	 override fun onPositionDiscontinuity(
 65	 oldPosition: Player.PositionInfo,
 66	 newPosition: Player.PositionInfo,
 67	 reason: Int
 68	 ) {
 69	 updateProgress()
 70	 }
 71	
 72	 override fun onMediaItemTransition(mediaItem: MediaItem?, reason: Int) {
 73	 // Handle song change
 74	 mediaItem?.let {
 75	 // Convert MediaItem back to Song if needed
 76	 playbackStateListener?.onSongChanged(null) // TODO: Convert MediaItem to Song
 77	 }
 78	 }
 79	 })
 80	
 81	 // Start progress updates
 82	 startProgressUpdates()
 83	 } catch (e: Exception) {
 84	 e.printStackTrace()
 85	 }
 86	 }, MoreExecutors.directExecutor())
 87	 }
 88	 
 89	 fun disconnect() {
 90	 mediaController?.release()
 91	 mediaControllerFuture?.cancel(true)
 92	 mediaController = null
 93	 mediaControllerFuture = null
 94	 }
 95	 
 96	 fun playSong(song: Song) {
 97	 val mediaItem = MusicService.createMediaItem(song)
 98	 mediaController?.setMediaItem(mediaItem)
 99	 mediaController?.prepare()
 100	 mediaController?.play()
 101	 }
 102	 
 103	 fun playPlaylist(songs: List<Song>, startIndex: Int = 0) {
 104	 Log.d(TAG, "playPlaylist called with ${songs.size} songs, startIndex: $startIndex")
 105	 val mediaItems = MusicService.createMediaItems(songs)
 106	 mediaController?.let { controller ->
 107	 Log.d(TAG, "Setting media items and starting playback")
 108	 controller.setMediaItems(mediaItems, startIndex, 0)
 109	 controller.prepare()
 110	 controller.play()
 111	 } ?: Log.e(TAG, "MediaController is null, cannot play playlist")
 112	 }
 113	 
 114	 fun playPause() {
 115	 mediaController?.let { controller ->
 116	 if (controller.isPlaying) {
 117	 controller.pause()
 118	 } else {
 119	 controller.play()
 120	 }
 121	 }
 122	 }
 123	 
 124	 fun skipToNext() {
 125	 mediaController?.seekToNext()
 126	 }
 127	 
 128	 fun skipToPrevious() {
 129	 mediaController?.seekToPrevious()
 130	 }
 131	 
 132	 fun seekTo(position: Long) {
 133	 mediaController?.seekTo(position)
 134	 }

 31	
 32	### When You Click a Song:
 33	1. **MainActivity** `onSongClicked()` **PlayerActivity**
 34	2. **PlayerActivity** `initializePlayer()` **PlayerPresenter**
 35	3. **PlayerPresenter** `playPlaylist()` **MusicServiceConnection**
 36	4. **MusicServiceConnection** **MusicService** **ExoPlayer**
 37	5. **ExoPlayer** starts streaming the song from URL
 38	
 39	### Real-time Updates:
 40	- Progress bar updates automatically
 41	- Play/pause button state changes
 42	- Song information displays
 43	- Navigation buttons work
 44	
 45	## How to Test
 46	
 47	### 1. **Build and Install**
 48	```bash
 49	./gradlew assembleDebug
 50	# Install APK on device/emulator
 51	```

 1	package com.nauh.musicplayer.data.model
 2	
 3	import android.os.Parcelable
 4	import kotlinx.parcelize.Parcelize
 5	
 6	/**
 7	 * Data model representing a song with all necessary information for streaming
 8	 */
 9	@Parcelize
 10	data class Song(
 11	 val id: String,
 12	 val title: String,
 13	 val artist: String,
 14	 val album: String,
 15	 val duration: Long, // Duration in milliseconds
 16	 val artworkUrl: String,
 17	 val streamUrl: String,
 18	 val genre: String? = null,
 19	 val releaseYear: Int? = null,
 20	 val trackNumber: Int? = null
 21	) : Parcelable {
 22	 
 23	 /**
 24	 * Returns formatted duration string (mm:ss)
 25	 */
 26	 fun getFormattedDuration(): String {
 27	 val minutes = (duration / 1000) / 60
 28	 val seconds = (duration / 1000) % 60
 29	 return String.format("%02d:%02d", minutes, seconds)
 30	 }
 31	 
 32	 /**
 33	 * Returns display text for artist and album
 34	 */
 35	 fun getArtistAlbumText(): String {
 36	 return "$artist $album"
 37	 }
 38	}
...
Path: app/src/main/java/com/nauh/musicplayer/data/model/Playlist.kt
 1	package com.nauh.musicplayer.data.model
 2	
 3	import android.os.Parcelable
 4	import kotlinx.parcelize.Parcelize
 5	
 6	/**
 7	 * Data model representing a playlist containing multiple songs
 8	 */
 9	@Parcelize
 10	data class Playlist(
 11	 val id: String,
 12	 val name: String,
 13	 val description: String? = null,
 14	 val songs: List<Song> = emptyList(),
 15	 val artworkUrl: String? = null,
 16	 val createdAt: Long = System.currentTimeMillis()
 17	) : Parcelable {
 18	 
 19	 /**
 20	 * Returns total duration of all songs in the playlist
 21	 */
 22	 fun getTotalDuration(): Long {
 23	 return songs.sumOf { it.duration }
 24	 }
 25	 
 26	 /**
 27	 * Returns formatted total duration string
 28	 */
 29	 fun getFormattedTotalDuration(): String {
 30	 val totalSeconds = getTotalDuration() / 1000
 31	 val hours = totalSeconds / 3600
 32	 val minutes = (totalSeconds % 3600) / 60
 33	 
 34	 return if (hours > 0) {
 35	 String.format("%d:%02d:%02d", hours, minutes, totalSeconds % 60)
 36	 } else {
 37	 String.format("%02d:%02d", minutes, totalSeconds % 60)
 38	 }
 39	 }
 40	 
 41	 /**
 42	 * Returns the number of songs in the playlist
 43	 */
 44	 fun getSongCount(): Int = songs.size
 45	}
...

 10	/**
 11	 * Repository class that handles data operations for music
 12	 * Implements the Repository pattern to abstract data sources
 13	 */
 14	class MusicRepository(
 15	 private val apiService: MusicApiService? = null
 16	) {
 17	 
 18	 /**
 19	 * Fetch all songs from the data source
 20	 * For demo purposes, returns mock data with simulated network delay
 21	 */
 22	 suspend fun getAllSongs(): Result<List<Song>> {
 23	 return withContext(Dispatchers.IO) {
 24	 try {
 25	 // Simulate network delay
 26	 delay(1000)
 27	 
 28	 // For demo purposes, return mock data
 29	 // In a real app, this would call apiService.getAllSongs()
 30	 val songs = MockMusicData.getSampleSongs()
 31	 Result.success(songs)
 32	 } catch (e: Exception) {
 33	 Result.failure(e)
 34	 }
 35	 }
 36	 }
 37	 
 38	 /**
 39	 * Search songs by query
 40	 */
 41	 suspend fun searchSongs(query: String): Result<List<Song>> {
 42	 return withContext(Dispatchers.IO) {
 43	 try {
 44	 delay(500) // Simulate network delay
 45	 
 46	 val allSongs = MockMusicData.getSampleSongs()
 47	 val filteredSongs = allSongs.filter { song ->
 48	 song.title.contains(query, ignoreCase = true) ||
 49	 song.artist.contains(query, ignoreCase = true) ||
 50	 song.album.contains(query, ignoreCase = true)
 51	 }
 52	 
 53	 Result.success(filteredSongs)
 54	 } catch (e: Exception) {
 55	 Result.failure(e)
 56	 }
 57	 }
 58	 }
 59	 
 60	 /**
 61	 * Get song by ID
 62	 */
 63	 suspend fun getSongById(id: String): Result<Song?> {
 64	 return withContext(Dispatchers.IO) {
 65	 try {
 66	 delay(300) // Simulate network delay
 67	 
 68	 val song = MockMusicData.getSampleSongs().find { it.id == id }
 69	 Result.success(song)
 70	 } catch (e: Exception) {
 71	 Result.failure(e)
 72	 }
 73	 }
 74	 }
 75	 
 76	 /**
 77	 * Get songs by genre
 78	 */
 79	 suspend fun getSongsByGenre(genre: String): Result<List<Song>> {
 80	 return withContext(Dispatchers.IO) {
 81	 try {
 82	 delay(500) // Simulate network delay
 83	 
 84	 val allSongs = MockMusicData.getSampleSongs()
 85	 val filteredSongs = allSongs.filter { song ->
 86	 song.genre?.equals(genre, ignoreCase = true) == true
 87	 }
 88	 
 89	 Result.success(filteredSongs)
 90	 } catch (e: Exception) {
 91	 Result.failure(e)
 92	 }
 93	 }
 94	 }

 27	class MusicService : MediaSessionService() {

 30	 private lateinit var player: ExoPlayer

...
 146	 
 147	 companion object {
 148	 private const val TAG = "MusicService"
 149	
 150	 /**
 151	 * Convert Song object to MediaItem for ExoPlayer
 152	 */
 153	 fun createMediaItem(song: Song): MediaItem {
 154	 Log.d(TAG, "Creating MediaItem for song: ${song.title}, URL: ${song.streamUrl}")
 155	
 156	 val metadata = MediaMetadata.Builder()
 157	 .setTitle(song.title)
 158	 .setArtist(song.artist)
 159	 .setAlbumTitle(song.album)
 160	 .setArtworkUri(android.net.Uri.parse(song.artworkUrl))
 161	 .build()
 162	
 163	 val mediaItem = MediaItem.Builder()
 164	 .setUri(song.streamUrl)
 165	 .setMediaId(song.id)
 166	 .setMediaMetadata(metadata)
 167	 .build()
 168	
 169	 Log.d(TAG, "MediaItem created with URI: ${mediaItem.localConfiguration?.uri}")
 170	 return mediaItem
 171	 }

 8	
 9	- **Dark Theme**: Elegant dark background with pink/red accent colors (#E91E63)
 10	- **Circular Album Art**: Songs display with circular album artwork using CircleImageView
 11	- **Mini Player**: Bottom mini player with progress bar and media controls
 12	- **Clean Layout**: Simple, intuitive interface focusing on music content
 13	- **Material Design**: Following Material Design 3 principles with dark theme
 14	
 15	## Architecture
 16	
 17	This application follows the **MVP (Model-View-Presenter)** architecture pattern with clear separation of concerns:
 18	
 19	### Model Layer
 20	- **Data Models**: `Song`, `Playlist` - Core data structures
 21	- **Repository**: `MusicRepository` - Data access abstraction
 22	- **API Service**: `MusicApiService` - Network data source interface

 1	package com.nauh.musicplayer.presenter
 2	
 3	import com.nauh.musicplayer.contract.MainContract
 4	import com.nauh.musicplayer.data.model.Song
 5	import com.nauh.musicplayer.data.repository.MusicRepository
 6	import kotlinx.coroutines.CoroutineScope
 7	import kotlinx.coroutines.Dispatchers
 8	import kotlinx.coroutines.Job
 9	import kotlinx.coroutines.launch
 10	import kotlinx.coroutines.withContext
 11	
 12	/**
 13	 * Presenter for the Main screen
 14	 * Handles business logic and communication between View and Model
 15	 */
 16	class MainPresenter(
 17	 private val repository: MusicRepository = MusicRepository.getInstance()
 18	) : MainContract.Presenter {
 19	 
 20	 private var view: MainContract.View? = null
 21	 private val presenterScope = CoroutineScope(Dispatchers.Main + Job())
 22	 private var currentSongs: List<Song> = emptyList()
 23	 private var searchJob: Job? = null
 24	 
 25	 override fun attachView(view: MainContract.View) {
 26	 this.view = view
 27	 }
 28	 
 29	 override fun detachView() {
 30	 this.view = null
 31	 searchJob?.cancel()
 32	 }
 33	 
 34	 override fun loadSongs() {
 35	 view?.showLoading()
 36	 
 37	 presenterScope.launch {
 38	 try {
 39	 val result = repository.getAllSongs()
 40	 
 41	 withContext(Dispatchers.Main) {
 42	 view?.hideLoading()
 43	 
 44	 result.fold(
 45	 onSuccess = { songs ->
 46	 currentSongs = songs
 47	 if (songs.isEmpty()) {
 48	 view?.showEmptyState()
 49	 } else {
 50	 view?.showSongs(songs)
 51	 }
 52	 },
 53	 onFailure = { exception ->
 54	 view?.showError(exception.message ?: "Failed to load songs")
 55	 }
 56	 )
 57	 }
 58	 } catch (e: Exception) {
 59	 withContext(Dispatchers.Main) {
 60	 view?.hideLoading()
 61	 view?.showError(e.message ?: "An unexpected error occurred")
 62	 }
 63	 }
 64	 }
 65	 }
 66	 
 67	 override fun onSongClicked(song: Song, playlist: List<Song>) {
 68	 view?.navigateToPlayer(song, playlist)
 69	 }
 70	 
 71	 override fun searchSongs(query: String) {
 72	 if (query.isBlank()) {
 73	 clearSearch()
 74	 return
 75	 }
 76	 
 77	 // Cancel previous search
 78	 searchJob?.cancel()
 79	 
 80	 searchJob = presenterScope.launch {
 81	 try {
 82	 val result = repository.searchSongs(query)
 83	 
 84	 withContext(Dispatchers.Main) {
 85	 result.fold(
 86	 onSuccess = { songs ->
 87	 view?.showSearchResults(songs)
 88	 },
 89	 onFailure = { exception ->
 90	 view?.showError(exception.message ?: "Search failed")
 91	 }
 92	 )
 93	 }
 94	 } catch (e: Exception) {
 95	 withContext(Dispatchers.Main) {
 96	 view?.showError(e.message ?: "Search failed")
 97	 }
 98	 }
 99	 }
 100	 }
 101	 
 102	 override fun clearSearch() {
 103	 searchJob?.cancel()
 104	 view?.clearSearchResults()
 105	 view?.showSongs(currentSongs)
 106	 }
 107	 
 108	 override fun refreshSongs() {
 109	 loadSongs()
 110	 }
 111	 
 112	 override fun onCurrentSongChanged(song: Song?) {
 113	 view?.updateCurrentPlayingSong(song)
 114	 }
 115	}

 37	 private fun initializeMusicService() {

 39	 musicServiceConnection?.setPlaybackStateListener(object : MusicServiceConnection.PlaybackStateListener {
 40	 override fun onPlaybackStateChanged(isPlaying: Boolean) {
 41	 view?.updatePlayPauseButton(isPlaying)
 42	 }
 43	
 44	 override fun onProgressUpdate(position: Long, duration: Long) {
 45	 view?.updateProgress(position, duration)
 46	
 47	 // Update seek bar
 48	 val progress = if (duration > 0) {
 49	 ((position.toFloat() / duration.toFloat()) * 100).toInt()
 50	 } else 0
 51	 view?.updateSeekBar(progress, 100)
 52	 }
 53	
 54	 override fun onSongChanged(song: Song?) {
 55	 song?.let {
 56	 currentSong = it
 57	 view?.showSongInfo(it)
 58	 }
 59	 }
 60	 })
 61	 musicServiceConnection?.connect()
 62	 }
 63	 
 64	 override fun initializePlayer(song: Song, playlist: List<Song>) {
 65	 Log.d(TAG, "initializePlayer called with song: ${song.title}, playlist size: ${playlist.size}")
 66	 this.currentSong = song
 67	 this.playlist = playlist
 68	 this.currentIndex = playlist.indexOf(song).takeIf { it >= 0 } ?: 0
 69	
 70	 Log.d(TAG, "Current index: $currentIndex")
 71	
 72	 view?.showSongInfo(song)
 73	 view?.updatePlaylist(playlist, currentIndex)
 74	 updateNavigationButtons()
 75	
 76	 // Start playing the song
 77	 Log.d(TAG, "Starting playback...")
 78	 musicServiceConnection?.playPlaylist(playlist, currentIndex)
 79	 }
 80	
 81	 override fun playPause() {
 82	 musicServiceConnection?.playPause()
 83	 }
 84	
 85	 override fun seekTo(position: Long) {
 86	 musicServiceConnection?.seekTo(position)
 87	 }
 88	 
 89	 override fun skipToNext() {
 90	 if (currentIndex < playlist.size - 1) {
 91	 currentIndex++
 92	 currentSong = playlist[currentIndex]
 93	 view?.showSongInfo(currentSong!!)
 94	 }
 95	 musicServiceConnection?.skipToNext()
 96	 updateNavigationButtons()
 97	 }
 98	
 99	 override fun skipToPrevious() {
 100	 if (currentIndex > 0) {
 101	 currentIndex--
 102	 currentSong = playlist[currentIndex]
 103	 view?.showSongInfo(currentSong!!)
 104	 }
 105	 musicServiceConnection?.skipToPrevious()
 106	 updateNavigationButtons()
 107	 }
 108	 
 109	 override fun toggleShuffle() {
 110	 isShuffled = !isShuffled
 111	 view?.showShuffleState(isShuffled)
 112	 updateNavigationButtons()
 113	 }

 152	 private fun updateNavigationButtons() {
 153	 val canGoPrevious = when {
 154	 isShuffled -> playlist.size > 1
 155	 repeatMode == PlayerContract.RepeatMode.ALL -> playlist.size > 1
 156	 else -> currentIndex > 0
 157	 }
 158	 
 159	 val canGoNext = when {
 160	 isShuffled -> playlist.size > 1
 161	 repeatMode == PlayerContract.RepeatMode.ALL -> playlist.size > 1
 162	 else -> currentIndex < playlist.size - 1
 163	 }
 164	 
 165	 view?.enablePreviousButton(canGoPrevious)
 166	 view?.enableNextButton(canGoNext)
 167	 }

 1	package com.nauh.musicplayer.data.repository
 2	
 3	import com.nauh.musicplayer.data.api.MockMusicData
 4	import com.nauh.musicplayer.data.api.MusicApiService
 5	import com.nauh.musicplayer.data.model.Song
 6	import kotlinx.coroutines.Dispatchers
 7	import kotlinx.coroutines.delay
 8	import kotlinx.coroutines.withContext
 9	
 10	/**
 11	 * Repository class that handles data operations for music
 12	 * Implements the Repository pattern to abstract data sources
 13	 */
 14	class MusicRepository(
 15	 private val apiService: MusicApiService? = null
 16	) {
 17	 
 18	 /**
 19	 * Fetch all songs from the data source
 20	 * For demo purposes, returns mock data with simulated network delay
 21	 */
 22	 suspend fun getAllSongs(): Result<List<Song>> {
 23	 return withContext(Dispatchers.IO) {
 24	 try {
 25	 // Simulate network delay
 26	 delay(1000)
 27	 
 28	 // For demo purposes, return mock data
 29	 // In a real app, this would call apiService.getAllSongs()
 30	 val songs = MockMusicData.getSampleSongs()
 31	 Result.success(songs)
 32	 } catch (e: Exception) {
 33	 Result.failure(e)
 34	 }
 35	 }
 36	 }
 37	 
 38	 /**
 39	 * Search songs by query
 40	 */
 41	 suspend fun searchSongs(query: String): Result<List<Song>> {
 42	 return withContext(Dispatchers.IO) {
 43	 try {
 44	 delay(500) // Simulate network delay
 45	 
 46	 val allSongs = MockMusicData.getSampleSongs()
 47	 val filteredSongs = allSongs.filter { song ->
 48	 song.title.contains(query, ignoreCase = true) ||
 49	 song.artist.contains(query, ignoreCase = true) ||
 50	 song.album.contains(query, ignoreCase = true)
 51	 }
 52	 
 53	 Result.success(filteredSongs)
 54	 } catch (e: Exception) {
 55	 Result.failure(e)
 56	 }
 57	 }
 58	 }
 59	 
 60	 /**
 61	 * Get song by ID
 62	 */
 63	 suspend fun getSongById(id: String): Result<Song?> {
 64	 return withContext(Dispatchers.IO) {
 65	 try {
 66	 delay(300) // Simulate network delay
 67	 
 68	 val song = MockMusicData.getSampleSongs().find { it.id == id }
 69	 Result.success(song)
 70	 } catch (e: Exception) {
 71	 Result.failure(e)
 72	 }
 73	 }
 74	 }
 75	 
 76	 /**
 77	 * Get songs by genre
 78	 */
 79	 suspend fun getSongsByGenre(genre: String): Result<List<Song>> {
 80	 return withContext(Dispatchers.IO) {
 81	 try {
 82	 delay(500) // Simulate network delay
 83	 
 84	 val allSongs = MockMusicData.getSampleSongs()
 85	 val filteredSongs = allSongs.filter { song ->
 86	 song.genre?.equals(genre, ignoreCase = true) == true
 87	 }
 88	 
 89	 Result.success(filteredSongs)
 90	 } catch (e: Exception) {
 91	 Result.failure(e)
 92	 }
 93	 }
 94	 }
 95	 
 96	 companion object {
 97	 @Volatile
 98	 private var INSTANCE: MusicRepository? = null
 99	 
 100	 fun getInstance(apiService: MusicApiService? = null): MusicRepository {
 101	 return INSTANCE ?: synchronized(this) {
 102	 INSTANCE ?: MusicRepository(apiService).also { INSTANCE = it }
 103	 }
 104	 }
 105	 }
 106	}

 20	import com.nauh.musicplayer.data.model.Song

 23	/**
 24	 * Background music service using ExoPlayer and MediaSession
 25	 * Handles audio playback, notifications, and media controls
 26	 */
 27	class MusicService : MediaSessionService() {
 28	
 29	 private var mediaSession: MediaSession? = null
 30	 private lateinit var player: ExoPlayer
 31	
 32	
 33	
 34	 override fun onCreate() {
 35	 super.onCreate()
 36	 Log.d(TAG, "MusicService onCreate")
 37	 initializePlayer()
 38	 initializeMediaSession()
 39	 }
 40	 
 41	 private fun initializePlayer() {
 42	 Log.d(TAG, "Initializing ExoPlayer")
 43	
 44	 // Create a custom HTTP data source factory with better error handling
 45	 val httpDataSourceFactory = DefaultHttpDataSource.Factory()
 46	 .setUserAgent("MusicPlayer/1.0")
 47	 .setConnectTimeoutMs(30000)
 48	 .setReadTimeoutMs(30000)
 49	 .setAllowCrossProtocolRedirects(true)
 50	
 51	 val mediaSourceFactory = DefaultMediaSourceFactory(this)
 52	 .setDataSourceFactory(httpDataSourceFactory)
 53	
 54	 player = ExoPlayer.Builder(this)
 55	 .setMediaSourceFactory(mediaSourceFactory)
 56	 .setAudioAttributes(
 57	 AudioAttributes.Builder()
 58	 .setContentType(C.AUDIO_CONTENT_TYPE_MUSIC)
 59	 .setUsage(C.USAGE_MEDIA)
 60	 .build(),
 61	 true
 62	 )
 63	 .setHandleAudioBecomingNoisy(true)
 64	 .build()

 79	 override fun onPlayerError(error: PlaybackException) {
 80	 Log.e(TAG, "Player error: ${error.message}", error)
 81	 Log.e(TAG, "Error code: ${error.errorCode}")
 82	 Log.e(TAG, "Error cause: ${error.cause?.message}")
 83	
 84	 // Try to recover from certain errors
 85	 when (error.errorCode) {
 86	 PlaybackException.ERROR_CODE_IO_NETWORK_CONNECTION_FAILED,
 87	 PlaybackException.ERROR_CODE_IO_NETWORK_CONNECTION_TIMEOUT -> {
 88	 Log.d(TAG, "Network error, attempting to retry...")
 89	 // Could implement retry logic here
 90	 }
 91	 PlaybackException.ERROR_CODE_PARSING_CONTAINER_MALFORMED,
 92	 PlaybackException.ERROR_CODE_PARSING_MANIFEST_MALFORMED -> {
 93	 Log.e(TAG, "Media format error, skipping to next track")
 94	 // Could skip to next track automatically
 95	 }
 96	 }
 97	 }
 98	 })
 99	 }
 100	 
 101	 private fun initializeMediaSession() {
 102	 val sessionActivityPendingIntent = PendingIntent.getActivity(
 103	 this,
 104	 0,
 105	 Intent(this, MainActivity::class.java),
 106	 PendingIntent.FLAG_IMMUTABLE
 107	 )
 108	 
 109	 mediaSession = MediaSession.Builder(this, player)
 110	 .setSessionActivity(sessionActivityPendingIntent)
 111	 .setCallback(MediaSessionCallback())
 112	 .build()
 113	 }
 114	 
 115	 override fun onGetSession(controllerInfo: MediaSession.ControllerInfo): MediaSession? {
 116	 return mediaSession
 117	 }
 118	 
 119	 override fun onDestroy() {
 120	 mediaSession?.run {
 121	 player.release()
 122	 release()
 123	 mediaSession = null
 124	 }
 125	 super.onDestroy()
 126	 }

 149	
 150	 /**
 151	 * Convert Song object to MediaItem for ExoPlayer
 152	 */
 153	 fun createMediaItem(song: Song): MediaItem {
 154	 Log.d(TAG, "Creating MediaItem for song: ${song.title}, URL: ${song.streamUrl}")
 155	
 156	 val metadata = MediaMetadata.Builder()
 157	 .setTitle(song.title)
 158	 .setArtist(song.artist)
 159	 .setAlbumTitle(song.album)
 160	 .setArtworkUri(android.net.Uri.parse(song.artworkUrl))
 161	 .build()
 162	
 163	 val mediaItem = MediaItem.Builder()
 164	 .setUri(song.streamUrl)
 165	 .setMediaId(song.id)
 166	 .setMediaMetadata(metadata)
 167	 .build()
 168	
 169	 Log.d(TAG, "MediaItem created with URI: ${mediaItem.localConfiguration?.uri}")
 170	 return mediaItem
 171	 }

 17	/**
 18	 * Service connection class to manage communication between UI and MusicService
 19	 * Handles MediaController setup and provides playback control methods
 20	 */
 21	class MusicServiceConnection(private val context: Context) {
 22	
 23	 private var mediaControllerFuture: ListenableFuture<MediaController>? = null
 24	 private var mediaController: MediaController? = null
 25	 private var playbackStateListener: PlaybackStateListener? = null
 26	 private var isConnected = false
 27	 private var pendingPlaylist: Pair<List<Song>, Int>? = null
 28	
 29	 companion object {
 30	 private const val TAG = "MusicServiceConnection"
 31	 }
 32	 
 33	 interface PlaybackStateListener {
 34	 fun onPlaybackStateChanged(isPlaying: Boolean)
 35	 fun onProgressUpdate(position: Long, duration: Long)
 36	 fun onSongChanged(song: Song?)
 37	 }
 38	 
 39	 fun setPlaybackStateListener(listener: PlaybackStateListener) {
 40	 this.playbackStateListener = listener
 41	 }
 42	 
 43	 fun connect() {
 44	 Log.d(TAG, "Connecting to MusicService...")
 45	 // Start the service first to ensure it's running
 46	 val serviceIntent = Intent(context, MusicService::class.java)
 47	 context.startService(serviceIntent)
 48	
 49	 val sessionToken = SessionToken(context, ComponentName(context, MusicService::class.java))
 50	 mediaControllerFuture = MediaController.Builder(context, sessionToken).buildAsync()
 51	
 52	 mediaControllerFuture?.addListener({
 53	 try {
 54	 mediaController = mediaControllerFuture?.get()
 55	 isConnected = true
 56	 Log.d(TAG, "MediaController connected successfully")
 57	
 58	 mediaController?.addListener(object : Player.Listener {
 59	 override fun onPlaybackStateChanged(playbackState: Int) {
 60	 val stateString = when (playbackState) {
 61	 Player.STATE_IDLE -> "IDLE"
 62	 Player.STATE_BUFFERING -> "BUFFERING"
 63	 Player.STATE_READY -> "READY"
 64	 Player.STATE_ENDED -> "ENDED"
 65	 else -> "UNKNOWN"
 66	 }
 67	 Log.d(TAG, "Player state changed to: $stateString")
 68	 val isPlaying = mediaController?.isPlaying ?: false
 69	 playbackStateListener?.onPlaybackStateChanged(isPlaying)
 70	 }
 71	
 72	 override fun onIsPlayingChanged(isPlaying: Boolean) {
 73	 Log.d(TAG, "Is playing changed to: $isPlaying")
 74	 playbackStateListener?.onPlaybackStateChanged(isPlaying)
 75	 }
 76	
 77	 override fun onPositionDiscontinuity(
 78	 oldPosition: Player.PositionInfo,
 79	 newPosition: Player.PositionInfo,
 80	 reason: Int
 81	 ) {
 82	 updateProgress()
 83	 }
 84	
 85	 override fun onMediaItemTransition(mediaItem: MediaItem?, reason: Int) {
 86	 Log.d(TAG, "Media item transition: ${mediaItem?.mediaId}")
 87	 // Handle song change
 88	 mediaItem?.let {
 89	 // Convert MediaItem back to Song if needed
 90	 playbackStateListener?.onSongChanged(null) // TODO: Convert MediaItem to Song
 91	 }
 92	 }
 93	 })
 94	
 95	 // Start progress updates
 96	 startProgressUpdates()
 97	
 98	 // Play pending playlist if any
 99	 pendingPlaylist?.let { (songs, startIndex) ->
 100	 Log.d(TAG, "Playing pending playlist")
 101	 playPlaylistInternal(songs, startIndex)
 102	 pendingPlaylist = null
 103	 }
 104	
 105	 } catch (e: Exception) {
 106	 Log.e(TAG, "Error connecting MediaController", e)
 107	 e.printStackTrace()
 108	 }
 109	 }, MoreExecutors.directExecutor())
 110	 }
 111	 
 112	 fun disconnect() {
 113	 Log.d(TAG, "Disconnecting from MusicService")
 114	 isConnected = false
 115	 pendingPlaylist = null
 116	 mediaController?.release()
 117	 mediaControllerFuture?.cancel(true)
 118	 mediaController = null
 119	 mediaControllerFuture = null
 120	 }
 121	 
 122	 fun playSong(song: Song) {
 123	 val mediaItem = MusicService.createMediaItem(song)
 124	 mediaController?.setMediaItem(mediaItem)
 125	 mediaController?.prepare()
 126	 mediaController?.play()
 127	 }
 128	 
 129	 fun playPlaylist(songs: List<Song>, startIndex: Int = 0) {
 130	 Log.d(TAG, "playPlaylist called with ${songs.size} songs, startIndex: $startIndex")
 131	 if (isConnected && mediaController != null) {
 132	 playPlaylistInternal(songs, startIndex)
 133	 } else {
 134	 Log.d(TAG, "MediaController not ready, storing playlist for later")
 135	 pendingPlaylist = Pair(songs, startIndex)
 136	 }
 137	 }
 138	
 139	 private fun playPlaylistInternal(songs: List<Song>, startIndex: Int = 0) {
 140	 Log.d(TAG, "playPlaylistInternal called with ${songs.size} songs, startIndex: $startIndex")
 141	 val mediaItems = MusicService.createMediaItems(songs)
 142	
 143	 // Log each media item for debugging
 144	 mediaItems.forEachIndexed { index, mediaItem ->
 145	 Log.d(TAG, "MediaItem $index: ${mediaItem.mediaId} - ${mediaItem.requestMetadata.mediaUri}")
 146	 }
 147	
 148	 mediaController?.let { controller ->
 149	 Log.d(TAG, "Setting media items and starting playback")
 150	 controller.setMediaItems(mediaItems, startIndex, 0)
 151	 controller.prepare()
 152	 controller.play()
 153	 Log.d(TAG, "Playback started")
 154	 } ?: Log.e(TAG, "MediaController is null, cannot play playlist")
 155	 }
 156	 
 157	 fun playPause() {
 158	 mediaController?.let { controller ->
 159	 if (controller.isPlaying) {
 160	 controller.pause()
 161	 } else {
 162	 controller.play()
 163	 }
 164	 }
 165	 }
 166	 
 167	 fun skipToNext() {
 168	 Log.d(TAG, "skipToNext called")
 169	 mediaController?.let { controller ->
 170	 if (controller.hasNextMediaItem()) {
 171	 controller.seekToNextMediaItem()
 172	 Log.d(TAG, "Skipped to next track")
 173	 } else {
 174	 Log.d(TAG, "No next track available")
 175	 }
 176	 } ?: Log.e(TAG, "MediaController is null, cannot skip to next")
 177	 }
 178	
 179	 fun skipToPrevious() {
 180	 Log.d(TAG, "skipToPrevious called")
 181	 mediaController?.let { controller ->
 182	 if (controller.hasPreviousMediaItem()) {
 183	 controller.seekToPreviousMediaItem()
 184	 Log.d(TAG, "Skipped to previous track")
 185	 } else {
 186	 Log.d(TAG, "No previous track available")
 187	 }
 188	 } ?: Log.e(TAG, "MediaController is null, cannot skip to previous")
 189	 }
 190	 
 191	 fun seekTo(position: Long) {
 192	 mediaController?.seekTo(position)
 193	 }
 194	 
 195	 fun isPlaying(): Boolean {
 196	 return mediaController?.isPlaying ?: false
 197	 }
 198	 
 199	 fun getCurrentPosition(): Long {
 200	 return mediaController?.currentPosition ?: 0L
 201	 }
 202	 
 203	 fun getDuration(): Long {
 204	 return mediaController?.duration ?: 0L
 205	 }
 206	 
 207	 private fun startProgressUpdates() {
 208	 // Start a handler to update progress regularly
 209	 val handler = android.os.Handler(android.os.Looper.getMainLooper())
 210	 val progressRunnable = object : Runnable {
 211	 override fun run() {
 212	 if (mediaController != null) {
 213	 updateProgress()
 214	 handler.postDelayed(this, 1000) // Update every second
 215	 }
 216	 }
 217	 }
 218	 handler.post(progressRunnable)
 219	 }
 220	 
 221	 private fun updateProgress() {
 222	 val position = getCurrentPosition()
 223	 val duration = getDuration()
 224	 playbackStateListener?.onProgressUpdate(position, duration)
 225	 }
 226	}

IF MORE CONTENT NEEDS TO BE ADDED USE THE str-replace-editor TOOL TO EDIT THE FILE AFTER IT HAS BEEN CREATED.", "path": "app/src/main/java/com/nauh/musicplayer/data/provider/LocalMusicProvider.kt", "file_content": "package com.nauh.musicplayer.data.provider\n\nimport android.content.Context\nimport android.media.MediaMetadataRetriever\nimport android.net.Uri\nimport android.util.Log\nimport com.nauh.musicplayer.R\nimport com.nauh.musicplayer.data.model.Song\nimport java.lang.reflect.Field\n\n/**\n * Provider class for loading music files from the app's raw resources directory\n * Scans res/raw folder and creates Song objects for local music files\n */\nclass LocalMusicProvider(private val context: Context) {\n \n companion object {\n private const val TAG = \"LocalMusicProvider\"\n private const val DEFAULT_ARTWORK_URL = \"android.resource://com.nauh.musicplayer/drawable/placeholder_album_art\"\n }\n \n /**\n * Scans the res/raw directory and returns a list of Song objects for all music files\n */\n fun getLocalSongs(): List<Song> {\n Log.d(TAG, \"Scanning local music files from res/raw\")\n val songs = mutableListOf<Song>()\n \n try {\n // Get all raw resource IDs using reflection\n val rawResourceIds = getRawResourceIds()\n Log.d(TAG, \"Found ${rawResourceIds.size} raw resources\")\n \n rawResourceIds.forEach { (resourceName, resourceId) ->\n if (isMusicFile(resourceName)) {\n Log.d(TAG, \"Processing music file: $resourceName\")\n val song = createSongFromRawResource(resourceName, resourceId)\n if (song != null) {\n songs.add(song)\n Log.d(TAG, \"Added song: ${song.title}\")\n }\n }\n }\n \n } catch (e: Exception) {\n Log.e(TAG, \"Error scanning local music files\", e)\n }\n \n Log.d(TAG, \"Successfully loaded ${songs.size} local songs\")\n return songs\n }\n \n /**\n * Gets all raw resource IDs using reflection\n */\n private fun getRawResourceIds(): Map<String, Int> {\n val resourceMap = mutableMapOf<String, Int>()\n \n try {\n val rawClass = R.raw::class.java\n val fields: Array<Field> = rawClass.declaredFields\n \n for (field in fields) {\n try {\n val resourceName = field.name\n val resourceId = field.getInt(null)\n resourceMap[resourceName] = resourceId\n Log.d(TAG, \"Found raw resource: $resourceName -> $resourceId\")\n } catch (e: Exception) {\n Log.w(TAG, \"Could not access field: ${field.name}\", e)\n }\n }\n } catch (e: Exception) {\n Log.e(TAG, \"Error getting raw resource IDs\", e)\n }\n \n return resourceMap\n }\n \n /**\n * Checks if a resource name represents a music file based on common audio file extensions\n */\n private fun isMusicFile(resourceName: String): Boolean {\n val audioExtensions = listOf(\"mp3\", \"wav\", \"m4a\", \"aac\", \"ogg\", \"flac\")\n return audioExtensions.any { ext ->\n resourceName.lowercase().contains(ext) || resourceName.lowercase().endsWith(\"_$ext\")\n }\n }\n \n /**\n * Creates a Song object from a raw resource\n */\n private fun createSongFromRawResource(resourceName: String, resourceId: Int): Song? {\n return try {\n val uri = Uri.parse(\"android.resource://${context.packageName}/$resourceId\")\n Log.d(TAG, \"Created URI for $resourceName: $uri\")\n \n // Extract metadata using MediaMetadataRetriever\n val metadata = extractMetadata(uri)\n \n // Generate song details\n val title = metadata.title ?: formatResourceNameAsTitle(resourceName)\n val artist = metadata.artist ?: \"Local Artist\"\n val album = metadata.album ?: \"Local Music\"\n val duration = metadata.duration ?: estimateDuration()\n \n Song(\n id = \"local_$resourceId\",\n title = title,\n artist = artist,\n album = album,\n duration = duration,\n artworkUrl = DEFAULT_ARTWORK_URL,\n streamUrl = uri.toString(),\n genre = \"Local\"\n )\n } catch (e: Exception) {\n Log.e(TAG, \"Error creating song from resource: $resourceName\", e)\n null\n }\n }\n \n /**\n * Data class to hold extracted metadata\n */\n private data class AudioMetadata(\n val title: String? = null,\n val artist: String? = null,\n val album: String? = null,\n val duration: Long? = null\n )\n \n /**\n * Extracts metadata from audio file using MediaMetadataRetriever\n */\n private fun extractMetadata(uri: Uri): AudioMetadata {\n var retriever: MediaMetadataRetriever? = null\n return try {\n retriever = MediaMetadataRetriever()\n retriever.setDataSource(context, uri)\n \n val title = retriever.extractMetadata(MediaMetadataRetriever.METADATA_KEY_TITLE)\n val artist = retriever.extractMetadata(MediaMetadataRetriever.METADATA_KEY_ARTIST)\n val album = retriever.extractMetadata(MediaMetadataRetriever.METADATA_KEY_ALBUM)\n val durationStr = retriever.extractMetadata(MediaMetadataRetriever.METADATA_KEY_DURATION)\n val duration = durationStr?.toLongOrNull()\n \n Log.d(TAG, \"Extracted metadata - Title: $title, Artist: $artist, Album: $album, Duration: $duration\")\n \n AudioMetadata(title, artist, album, duration)\n } catch (e: Exception) {\n Log.w(TAG, \"Could not extract metadata from $uri\", e)\n AudioMetadata()\n } finally {\n try {\n retriever?.release()\n } catch (e: Exception) {\n Log.w(TAG, \"Error releasing MediaMetadataRetriever\", e)\n }\n }\n }\n \n /**\n * Formats a resource name into a readable title\n * Converts underscores to spaces and capitalizes words\n */\n private fun formatResourceNameAsTitle(resourceName: String): String {\n return resourceName\n .replace(\"_\", \" \")\n .replace(\"-\", \" \")\n .split(\" \")\n .joinToString(\" \") { word ->\n word.replaceFirstChar { if (it.isLowerCase()) it.titlecase() else it.toString() }\n }\n .trim()\n }\n \n /**\n * Provides a default duration estimate for files where metadata extraction fails\n */\n private fun estimateDuration(): Long {\n return 180000L // 3 minutes default\n }\n}"}","mcp_server_name":"","mcp_tool_name":""}},{"id":2,"type":0,"content":"Perfect! Now I have a good understanding of the current architecture. Let me create a detailed plan for implementing the functionality to load and play music files from the `res/raw` directory.

## Analysis and Plan

Based on my analysis of the codebase, here's what I found:

1. **Current Architecture**: The app uses MVP pattern with:
 - `Song` data model with `streamUrl` property for audio source
 - `MusicRepository` that currently returns mock data
 - `MusicService` using ExoPlayer for playback
 - Raw music files already exist in `app/src/main/res/raw/`

2. **Current Flow**: 
 - `MainPresenter.loadSongs()` `MusicRepository.getAllSongs()` `MockMusicData.getSampleSongs()`
 - Songs have `streamUrl` pointing to external URLs
 - `MusicService.createMediaItem()` creates ExoPlayer MediaItems from Song objects

## Detailed Implementation Plan

I need to implement the following changes:

1. **Create a LocalMusicProvider class** to scan and load music files from `res/raw` directory
2. **Modify MusicRepository** to include local songs alongside existing mock data
3. **Update MusicService** to handle both HTTP URLs and Android resource URIs
4. **Ensure proper metadata extraction** for local files (duration, title parsing from filename)
5. **Update the data flow** to combine local and remote sources

### Files to modify/create:
- Create: `app/src/main/java/com/nauh/musicplayer/data/provider/LocalMusicProvider.kt`
- Modify: `app/src/main/java/com/nauh/musicplayer/data/repository/MusicRepository.kt`
- Modify: `app/src/main/java/com/nauh/musicplayer/service/MusicService.kt`

 25	 */
 26	 fun getFormattedDuration(): String {
 27	 val minutes = (duration / 1000) / 60
 28	 val seconds = (duration / 1000) % 60
 29	 return String.format("%02d:%02d", minutes, seconds)
 30	 }
 31	 
 32	 /**
 33	 * Returns display text for artist and album
 34	 */
 35	 fun getArtistAlbumText(): String {
 36	 return "$artist $album"
 37	 }

 1	package com.nauh.musicplayer.data.model
 2	
 3	import android.os.Parcelable
 4	import kotlinx.parcelize.Parcelize
 5	
 6	/**
 7	 * Data model representing a playlist containing multiple songs
 8	 */
 9	@Parcelize
 10	data class Playlist(
 11	 val id: String,
 12	 val name: String,
 13	 val description: String? = null,
 14	 val songs: List<Song> = emptyList(),
 15	 val artworkUrl: String? = null,
 16	 val createdAt: Long = System.currentTimeMillis()
 17	) : Parcelable {
 18	 
 19	 /**
 20	 * Returns total duration of all songs in the playlist
 21	 */
 22	 fun getTotalDuration(): Long {
 23	 return songs.sumOf { it.duration }
 24	 }
 25	 
 26	 /**
 27	 * Returns formatted total duration string
 28	 */
 29	 fun getFormattedTotalDuration(): String {
 30	 val totalSeconds = getTotalDuration() / 1000
 31	 val hours = totalSeconds / 3600
 32	 val minutes = (totalSeconds % 3600) / 60
 33	 
 34	 return if (hours > 0) {
 35	 String.format("%d:%02d:%02d", hours, minutes, totalSeconds % 60)
 36	 } else {
 37	 String.format("%02d:%02d", minutes, totalSeconds % 60)
 38	 }
 39	 }
 40	 
 41	 /**
 42	 * Returns the number of songs in the playlist
 43	 */
 44	 fun getSongCount(): Int = songs.size
 45	}

 10	/**
 11	 * Repository class that handles data operations for music
 12	 * Implements the Repository pattern to abstract data sources
 13	 */
 14	class MusicRepository(
 15	 private val apiService: MusicApiService? = null
 16	) {
 17	 
 18	 /**
 19	 * Fetch all songs from the data source
 20	 * For demo purposes, returns mock data with simulated network delay
 21	 */
 22	 suspend fun getAllSongs(): Result<List<Song>> {
 23	 return withContext(Dispatchers.IO) {
 24	 try {
 25	 // Simulate network delay
 26	 delay(1000)
 27	 
 28	 // For demo purposes, return mock data
 29	 // In a real app, this would call apiService.getAllSongs()
 30	 val songs = MockMusicData.getSampleSongs()
 31	 Result.success(songs)
 32	 } catch (e: Exception) {
 33	 Result.failure(e)
 34	 }
 35	 }
 36	 }
 37	 
 38	 /**
 39	 * Search songs by query
 40	 */
 41	 suspend fun searchSongs(query: String): Result<List<Song>> {
 42	 return withContext(Dispatchers.IO) {
 43	 try {
 44	 delay(500) // Simulate network delay
 45	 
 46	 val allSongs = MockMusicData.getSampleSongs()
 47	 val filteredSongs = allSongs.filter { song ->
 48	 song.title.contains(query, ignoreCase = true) ||
 49	 song.artist.contains(query, ignoreCase = true) ||
 50	 song.album.contains(query, ignoreCase = true)
 51	 }
 52	 
 53	 Result.success(filteredSongs)
 54	 } catch (e: Exception) {
 55	 Result.failure(e)
 56	 }
 57	 }
 58	 }
 59	 
 60	 /**
 61	 * Get song by ID
 62	 */
 63	 suspend fun getSongById(id: String): Result<Song?> {
 64	 return withContext(Dispatchers.IO) {
 65	 try {
 66	 delay(300) // Simulate network delay
 67	 
 68	 val song = MockMusicData.getSampleSongs().find { it.id == id }
 69	 Result.success(song)
 70	 } catch (e: Exception) {
 71	 Result.failure(e)
 72	 }
 73	 }
 74	 }
 75	 
 76	 /**
 77	 * Get songs by genre
 78	 */
 79	 suspend fun getSongsByGenre(genre: String): Result<List<Song>> {
 80	 return withContext(Dispatchers.IO) {
 81	 try {
 82	 delay(500) // Simulate network delay
 83	 
 84	 val allSongs = MockMusicData.getSampleSongs()
 85	 val filteredSongs = allSongs.filter { song ->
 86	 song.genre?.equals(genre, ignoreCase = true) == true
 87	 }
 88	 
 89	 Result.success(filteredSongs)
 90	 } catch (e: Exception) {

 147	 companion object {
 148	 private const val TAG = "MusicService"
 149	
 150	 /**
 151	 * Convert Song object to MediaItem for ExoPlayer
 152	 */
 153	 fun createMediaItem(song: Song): MediaItem {
 154	 Log.d(TAG, "Creating MediaItem for song: ${song.title}, URL: ${song.streamUrl}")
 155	
 156	 val metadata = MediaMetadata.Builder()
 157	 .setTitle(song.title)
 158	 .setArtist(song.artist)
 159	 .setAlbumTitle(song.album)
 160	 .setArtworkUri(android.net.Uri.parse(song.artworkUrl))
 161	 .build()
 162	
 163	 val mediaItem = MediaItem.Builder()
 164	 .setUri(song.streamUrl)
 165	 .setMediaId(song.id)
 166	 .setMediaMetadata(metadata)
 167	 .build()
 168	
 169	 Log.d(TAG, "MediaItem created with URI: ${mediaItem.localConfiguration?.uri}")
 170	 return mediaItem
 171	 }

 8	
 9	- **Dark Theme**: Elegant dark background with pink/red accent colors (#E91E63)
 10	- **Circular Album Art**: Songs display with circular album artwork using CircleImageView
 11	- **Mini Player**: Bottom mini player with progress bar and media controls
 12	- **Clean Layout**: Simple, intuitive interface focusing on music content
 13	- **Material Design**: Following Material Design 3 principles with dark theme
 14	
 15	## Architecture
 16	
 17	This application follows the **MVP (Model-View-Presenter)** architecture pattern with clear separation of concerns:
 18	
 19	### Model Layer
 20	- **Data Models**: `Song`, `Playlist` - Core data structures
 21	- **Repository**: `MusicRepository` - Data access abstraction
 22	- **API Service**: `MusicApiService` - Network data source interface

 1	package com.nauh.musicplayer.presenter
 2	
 3	import com.nauh.musicplayer.contract.MainContract
 4	import com.nauh.musicplayer.data.model.Song
 5	import com.nauh.musicplayer.data.repository.MusicRepository
 6	import kotlinx.coroutines.CoroutineScope
 7	import kotlinx.coroutines.Dispatchers
 8	import kotlinx.coroutines.Job
 9	import kotlinx.coroutines.launch
 10	import kotlinx.coroutines.withContext
 11	
 12	/**
 13	 * Presenter for the Main screen
 14	 * Handles business logic and communication between View and Model
 15	 */
 16	class MainPresenter(
 17	 private val repository: MusicRepository = MusicRepository.getInstance()
 18	) : MainContract.Presenter {
 19	 
 20	 private var view: MainContract.View? = null
 21	 private val presenterScope = CoroutineScope(Dispatchers.Main + Job())
 22	 private var currentSongs: List<Song> = emptyList()
 23	 private var searchJob: Job? = null
 24	 
 25	 override fun attachView(view: MainContract.View) {
 26	 this.view = view
 27	 }
 28	 
 29	 override fun detachView() {
 30	 this.view = null
 31	 searchJob?.cancel()
 32	 }
 33	 
 34	 override fun loadSongs() {
 35	 view?.showLoading()
 36	 
 37	 presenterScope.launch {
 38	 try {
 39	 val result = repository.getAllSongs()
 40	 
 41	 withContext(Dispatchers.Main) {
 42	 view?.hideLoading()
 43	 
 44	 result.fold(
 45	 onSuccess = { songs ->
 46	 currentSongs = songs
 47	 if (songs.isEmpty()) {
 48	 view?.showEmptyState()
 49	 } else {
 50	 view?.showSongs(songs)
 51	 }
 52	 },
 53	 onFailure = { exception ->
 54	 view?.showError(exception.message ?: "Failed to load songs")
 55	 }
 56	 )
 57	 }
 58	 } catch (e: Exception) {
 59	 withContext(Dispatchers.Main) {
 60	 view?.hideLoading()
 61	 view?.showError(e.message ?: "An unexpected error occurred")
 62	 }
 63	 }
 64	 }
 65	 }
 66	 
 67	 override fun onSongClicked(song: Song, playlist: List<Song>) {
 68	 view?.navigateToPlayer(song, playlist)
 69	 }
 70	 
 71	 override fun searchSongs(query: String) {
 72	 if (query.isBlank()) {
 73	 clearSearch()
 74	 return
 75	 }
 76	 
 77	 // Cancel previous search
 78	 searchJob?.cancel()
 79	 
 80	 searchJob = presenterScope.launch {
 81	 try {
 82	 val result = repository.searchSongs(query)
 83	 
 84	 withContext(Dispatchers.Main) {
 85	 result.fold(
 86	 onSuccess = { songs ->
 87	 view?.showSearchResults(songs)
 88	 },
 89	 onFailure = { exception ->
 90	 view?.showError(exception.message ?: "Search failed")
 91	 }
 92	 )
 93	 }
 94	 } catch (e: Exception) {
 95	 withContext(Dispatchers.Main) {
 96	 view?.showError(e.message ?: "Search failed")
 97	 }
 98	 }
 99	 }
 100	 }
 101	 
 102	 override fun clearSearch() {
 103	 searchJob?.cancel()
 104	 view?.clearSearchResults()
 105	 view?.showSongs(currentSongs)
 106	 }
 107	 
 108	 override fun refreshSongs() {
 109	 loadSongs()
 110	 }
 111	 
 112	 override fun onCurrentSongChanged(song: Song?) {
 113	 view?.updateCurrentPlayingSong(song)
 114	 }
 115	}

 36	
 37	 private fun initializeMusicService() {
 38	 musicServiceConnection = MusicServiceConnection(context)
 39	 musicServiceConnection?.setPlaybackStateListener(object : MusicServiceConnection.PlaybackStateListener {
 40	 override fun onPlaybackStateChanged(isPlaying: Boolean) {
 41	 view?.updatePlayPauseButton(isPlaying)
 42	 }
 43	
 44	 override fun onProgressUpdate(position: Long, duration: Long) {
 45	 view?.updateProgress(position, duration)
 46	
 47	 // Update seek bar
 48	 val progress = if (duration > 0) {
 49	 ((position.toFloat() / duration.toFloat()) * 100).toInt()
 50	 } else 0
 51	 view?.updateSeekBar(progress, 100)
 52	 }
 53	
 54	 override fun onSongChanged(song: Song?) {
 55	 song?.let {
 56	 currentSong = it
 57	 view?.showSongInfo(it)
 58	 }
 59	 }
 60	 })
 61	 musicServiceConnection?.connect()
 62	 }
 63	 
 64	 override fun initializePlayer(song: Song, playlist: List<Song>) {
 65	 Log.d(TAG, "initializePlayer called with song: ${song.title}, playlist size: ${playlist.size}")
 66	 this.currentSong = song
 67	 this.playlist = playlist
 68	 this.currentIndex = playlist.indexOf(song).takeIf { it >= 0 } ?: 0
 69	
 70	 Log.d(TAG, "Current index: $currentIndex")
 71	
 72	 view?.showSongInfo(song)
 73	 view?.updatePlaylist(playlist, currentIndex)
 74	 updateNavigationButtons()
 75	
 76	 // Start playing the song
 77	 Log.d(TAG, "Starting playback...")
 78	 musicServiceConnection?.playPlaylist(playlist, currentIndex)
 79	 }
 80	
 81	 override fun playPause() {
 82	 musicServiceConnection?.playPause()
 83	 }
 84	
 85	 override fun seekTo(position: Long) {
 86	 musicServiceConnection?.seekTo(position)
 87	 }
 88	 
 89	 override fun skipToNext() {
 90	 if (currentIndex < playlist.size - 1) {
 91	 currentIndex++
 92	 currentSong = playlist[currentIndex]
 93	 view?.showSongInfo(currentSong!!)
 94	 }
 95	 musicServiceConnection?.skipToNext()
 96	 updateNavigationButtons()
 97	 }
 98	
 99	 override fun skipToPrevious() {
 100	 if (currentIndex > 0) {
 101	 currentIndex--
 102	 currentSong = playlist[currentIndex]
 103	 view?.showSongInfo(currentSong!!)
 104	 }
 105	 musicServiceConnection?.skipToPrevious()
 106	 updateNavigationButtons()
 107	 }
 108	 
 109	 override fun toggleShuffle() {
 110	 isShuffled = !isShuffled
 111	 view?.showShuffleState(isShuffled)
 112	 updateNavigationButtons()
 113	 }

 140	 override fun onSongChanged(song: Song) {
 141	 currentSong = song

 143	 }
 144	 
 145	 override fun onPlaylistChanged(songs: List<Song>, currentIndex: Int) {
 146	 this.playlist = songs
 147	 this.currentIndex = currentIndex
 148	 view?.updatePlaylist(songs, currentIndex)
 149	 updateNavigationButtons()
 150	 }
 151	 
 152	 private fun updateNavigationButtons() {
 153	 val canGoPrevious = when {
 154	 isShuffled -> playlist.size > 1
 155	 repeatMode == PlayerContract.RepeatMode.ALL -> playlist.size > 1
 156	 else -> currentIndex > 0
 157	 }
 158	 
 159	 val canGoNext = when {
 160	 isShuffled -> playlist.size > 1
 161	 repeatMode == PlayerContract.RepeatMode.ALL -> playlist.size > 1
 162	 else -> currentIndex < playlist.size - 1
 163	 }
 164	 
 165	 view?.enablePreviousButton(canGoPrevious)
 166	 view?.enableNextButton(canGoNext)
 167	 }
 168	}

 3	import com.nauh.musicplayer.data.api.MockMusicData

 5	import com.nauh.musicplayer.data.model.Song
 6	import kotlinx.coroutines.Dispatchers
 7	import kotlinx.coroutines.delay
 8	import kotlinx.coroutines.withContext
 9	
 10	/**
 11	 * Repository class that handles data operations for music
 12	 * Implements the Repository pattern to abstract data sources
 13	 */
 14	class MusicRepository(
 15	 private val apiService: MusicApiService? = null
 16	) {
 17	 
 18	 /**
 19	 * Fetch all songs from the data source
 20	 * For demo purposes, returns mock data with simulated network delay
 21	 */
 22	 suspend fun getAllSongs(): Result<List<Song>> {
 23	 return withContext(Dispatchers.IO) {
 24	 try {
 25	 // Simulate network delay
 26	 delay(1000)
 27	 
 28	 // For demo purposes, return mock data
 29	 // In a real app, this would call apiService.getAllSongs()
 30	 val songs = MockMusicData.getSampleSongs()
 31	 Result.success(songs)
 32	 } catch (e: Exception) {
 33	 Result.failure(e)
 34	 }
 35	 }
 36	 }
 37	 
 38	 /**
 39	 * Search songs by query
 40	 */
 41	 suspend fun searchSongs(query: String): Result<List<Song>> {
 42	 return withContext(Dispatchers.IO) {
 43	 try {
 44	 delay(500) // Simulate network delay
 45	 
 46	 val allSongs = MockMusicData.getSampleSongs()
 47	 val filteredSongs = allSongs.filter { song ->
 48	 song.title.contains(query, ignoreCase = true) ||
 49	 song.artist.contains(query, ignoreCase = true) ||
 50	 song.album.contains(query, ignoreCase = true)
 51	 }
 52	 
 53	 Result.success(filteredSongs)
 54	 } catch (e: Exception) {
 55	 Result.failure(e)
 56	 }
 57	 }
 58	 }
 59	 
 60	 /**
 61	 * Get song by ID
 62	 */
 63	 suspend fun getSongById(id: String): Result<Song?> {
 64	 return withContext(Dispatchers.IO) {
 65	 try {
 66	 delay(300) // Simulate network delay
 67	 
 68	 val song = MockMusicData.getSampleSongs().find { it.id == id }
 69	 Result.success(song)
 70	 } catch (e: Exception) {
 71	 Result.failure(e)
 72	 }
 73	 }
 74	 }
 75	 
 76	 /**
 77	 * Get songs by genre
 78	 */
 79	 suspend fun getSongsByGenre(genre: String): Result<List<Song>> {
 80	 return withContext(Dispatchers.IO) {
 81	 try {
 82	 delay(500) // Simulate network delay
 83	 
 84	 val allSongs = MockMusicData.getSampleSongs()
 85	 val filteredSongs = allSongs.filter { song ->
 86	 song.genre?.equals(genre, ignoreCase = true) == true
 87	 }
 88	 
 89	 Result.success(filteredSongs)
 90	 } catch (e: Exception) {
 91	 Result.failure(e)
 92	 }
 93	 }
 94	 }
 95	 
 96	 companion object {
 97	 @Volatile
 98	 private var INSTANCE: MusicRepository? = null
 99	 
 100	 fun getInstance(apiService: MusicApiService? = null): MusicRepository {
 101	 return INSTANCE ?: synchronized(this) {
 102	 INSTANCE ?: MusicRepository(apiService).also { INSTANCE = it }
 103	 }
 104	 }
 105	 }
 106	}

 62	 )

 64	 .build()

 167	 .build()
 168	
 169	 Log.d(TAG, "MediaItem created with URI: ${mediaItem.localConfiguration?.uri}")
 170	 return mediaItem
 171	 }

 17	/**
 18	 * Service connection class to manage communication between UI and MusicService
 19	 * Handles MediaController setup and provides playback control methods
 20	 */
 21	class MusicServiceConnection(private val context: Context) {
 22	
 23	 private var mediaControllerFuture: ListenableFuture<MediaController>? = null
 24	 private var mediaController: MediaController? = null
 25	 private var playbackStateListener: PlaybackStateListener? = null
 26	 private var isConnected = false
 27	 private var pendingPlaylist: Pair<List<Song>, Int>? = null
 28	
 29	 companion object {
 30	 private const val TAG = "MusicServiceConnection"
 31	 }
 32	 
 33	 interface PlaybackStateListener {
 34	 fun onPlaybackStateChanged(isPlaying: Boolean)
 35	 fun onProgressUpdate(position: Long, duration: Long)
 36	 fun onSongChanged(song: Song?)
 37	 }
 38	 
 39	 fun setPlaybackStateListener(listener: PlaybackStateListener) {
 40	 this.playbackStateListener = listener
 41	 }
 42	 
 43	 fun connect() {
 44	 Log.d(TAG, "Connecting to MusicService...")
 45	 // Start the service first to ensure it's running
 46	 val serviceIntent = Intent(context, MusicService::class.java)
 47	 context.startService(serviceIntent)
 48	
 49	 val sessionToken = SessionToken(context, ComponentName(context, MusicService::class.java))
 50	 mediaControllerFuture = MediaController.Builder(context, sessionToken).buildAsync()
 51	
 52	 mediaControllerFuture?.addListener({
 53	 try {
 54	 mediaController = mediaControllerFuture?.get()
 55	 isConnected = true
 56	 Log.d(TAG, "MediaController connected successfully")
 57	
 58	 mediaController?.addListener(object : Player.Listener {
 59	 override fun onPlaybackStateChanged(playbackState: Int) {
 60	 val stateString = when (playbackState) {
 61	 Player.STATE_IDLE -> "IDLE"
 62	 Player.STATE_BUFFERING -> "BUFFERING"
 63	 Player.STATE_READY -> "READY"
 64	 Player.STATE_ENDED -> "ENDED"
 65	 else -> "UNKNOWN"
 66	 }
 67	 Log.d(TAG, "Player state changed to: $stateString")
 68	 val isPlaying = mediaController?.isPlaying ?: false
 69	 playbackStateListener?.onPlaybackStateChanged(isPlaying)
 70	 }
 71	
 72	 override fun onIsPlayingChanged(isPlaying: Boolean) {
 73	 Log.d(TAG, "Is playing changed to: $isPlaying")
 74	 playbackStateListener?.onPlaybackStateChanged(isPlaying)
 75	 }
 76	
 77	 override fun onPositionDiscontinuity(
 78	 oldPosition: Player.PositionInfo,
 79	 newPosition: Player.PositionInfo,
 80	 reason: Int
 81	 ) {
 82	 updateProgress()
 83	 }
 84	
 85	 override fun onMediaItemTransition(mediaItem: MediaItem?, reason: Int) {
 86	 Log.d(TAG, "Media item transition: ${mediaItem?.mediaId}")
 87	 // Handle song change
 88	 mediaItem?.let {
 89	 // Convert MediaItem back to Song if needed
 90	 playbackStateListener?.onSongChanged(null) // TODO: Convert MediaItem to Song
 91	 }
 92	 }
 93	 })
 94	
 95	 // Start progress updates
 96	 startProgressUpdates()
 97	
 98	 // Play pending playlist if any
 99	 pendingPlaylist?.let { (songs, startIndex) ->
 100	 Log.d(TAG, "Playing pending playlist")
 101	 playPlaylistInternal(songs, startIndex)
 102	 pendingPlaylist = null
 103	 }
 104	
 105	 } catch (e: Exception) {
 106	 Log.e(TAG, "Error connecting MediaController", e)
 107	 e.printStackTrace()
 108	 }
 109	 }, MoreExecutors.directExecutor())
 110	 }
 111	 
 112	 fun disconnect() {
 113	 Log.d(TAG, "Disconnecting from MusicService")
 114	 isConnected = false
 115	 pendingPlaylist = null
 116	 mediaController?.release()
 117	 mediaControllerFuture?.cancel(true)
 118	 mediaController = null
 119	 mediaControllerFuture = null
 120	 }
 121	 
 122	 fun playSong(song: Song) {
 123	 val mediaItem = MusicService.createMediaItem(song)
 124	 mediaController?.setMediaItem(mediaItem)
 125	 mediaController?.prepare()
 126	 mediaController?.play()
 127	 }
 128	 
 129	 fun playPlaylist(songs: List<Song>, startIndex: Int = 0) {
 130	 Log.d(TAG, "playPlaylist called with ${songs.size} songs, startIndex: $startIndex")
 131	 if (isConnected && mediaController != null) {
 132	 playPlaylistInternal(songs, startIndex)
 133	 } else {
 134	 Log.d(TAG, "MediaController not ready, storing playlist for later")
 135	 pendingPlaylist = Pair(songs, startIndex)
 136	 }
 137	 }
 138	
 139	 private fun playPlaylistInternal(songs: List<Song>, startIndex: Int = 0) {
 140	 Log.d(TAG, "playPlaylistInternal called with ${songs.size} songs, startIndex: $startIndex")
 141	 val mediaItems = MusicService.createMediaItems(songs)
 142	
 143	 // Log each media item for debugging
 144	 mediaItems.forEachIndexed { index, mediaItem ->
 145	 Log.d(TAG, "MediaItem $index: ${mediaItem.mediaId} - ${mediaItem.requestMetadata.mediaUri}")
 146	 }
 147	
 148	 mediaController?.let { controller ->
 149	 Log.d(TAG, "Setting media items and starting playback")
 150	 controller.setMediaItems(mediaItems, startIndex, 0)
 151	 controller.prepare()
 152	 controller.play()
 153	 Log.d(TAG, "Playback started")
 154	 } ?: Log.e(TAG, "MediaController is null, cannot play playlist")
 155	 }
 156	 
 157	 fun playPause() {
 158	 mediaController?.let { controller ->
 159	 if (controller.isPlaying) {
 160	 controller.pause()
 161	 } else {
 162	 controller.play()
 163	 }
 164	 }
 165	 }
 166	 
 167	 fun skipToNext() {
 168	 Log.d(TAG, "skipToNext called")
 169	 mediaController?.let { controller ->
 170	 if (controller.hasNextMediaItem()) {
 171	 controller.seekToNextMediaItem()
 172	 Log.d(TAG, "Skipped to next track")
 173	 } else {
 174	 Log.d(TAG, "No next track available")
 175	 }
 176	 } ?: Log.e(TAG, "MediaController is null, cannot skip to next")
 177	 }
 178	
 179	 fun skipToPrevious() {
 180	 Log.d(TAG, "skipToPrevious called")
 181	 mediaController?.let { controller ->
 182	 if (controller.hasPreviousMediaItem()) {
 183	 controller.seekToPreviousMediaItem()
 184	 Log.d(TAG, "Skipped to previous track")
 185	 } else {
 186	 Log.d(TAG, "No previous track available")
 187	 }
 188	 } ?: Log.e(TAG, "MediaController is null, cannot skip to previous")
 189	 }
 190	 
 191	 fun seekTo(position: Long) {
 192	 mediaController?.seekTo(position)
 193	 }
 194	 
 195	 fun isPlaying(): Boolean {
 196	 return mediaController?.isPlaying ?: false
 197	 }
 198	 
 199	 fun getCurrentPosition(): Long {
 200	 return mediaController?.currentPosition ?: 0L
 201	 }
 202	 
 203	 fun getDuration(): Long {
 204	 return mediaController?.duration ?: 0L
 205	 }
 206	 
 207	 private fun startProgressUpdates() {
 208	 // Start a handler to update progress regularly
 209	 val handler = android.os.Handler(android.os.Looper.getMainLooper())
 210	 val progressRunnable = object : Runnable {
 211	 override fun run() {
 212	 if (mediaController != null) {
 213	 updateProgress()
 214	 handler.postDelayed(this, 1000) // Update every second
 215	 }
 216	 }
 217	 }
 218	 handler.post(progressRunnable)
 219	 }
 220	 
 221	 private fun updateProgress() {
 222	 val position = getCurrentPosition()
 223	 val duration = getDuration()
 224	 playbackStateListener?.onProgressUpdate(position, duration)
 225	 }
 226	}

 9	/**
 10	 * Presenter for the Player screen
 11	 * Handles business logic for music playback and communication between View and Service
 12	 */
 13	class PlayerPresenter(private val context: Context) : PlayerContract.Presenter {
 14	
 15	 private var view: PlayerContract.View? = null
 16	 private var currentSong: Song? = null
 17	 private var playlist: List<Song> = emptyList()
 18	 private var currentIndex: Int = 0
 19	 private var isShuffled: Boolean = false
 20	 private var repeatMode: Int = PlayerContract.RepeatMode.OFF
 21	 private var musicServiceConnection: MusicServiceConnection? = null
 22	
 23	 companion object {
 24	 private const val TAG = "PlayerPresenter"
 25	 }
 26	 
 27	 override fun attachView(view: PlayerContract.View) {
 28	 this.view = view
 29	 initializeMusicService()
 30	 }

 37	 private fun initializeMusicService() {
 38	 musicServiceConnection = MusicServiceConnection(context)
 39	 musicServiceConnection?.setPlaybackStateListener(object : MusicServiceConnection.PlaybackStateListener {
 40	 override fun onPlaybackStateChanged(isPlaying: Boolean) {
 41	 view?.updatePlayPauseButton(isPlaying)
 42	 }
 43	
 44	 override fun onProgressUpdate(position: Long, duration: Long) {
 45	 view?.updateProgress(position, duration)
 46	
 47	 // Update seek bar
 48	 val progress = if (duration > 0) {
 49	 ((position.toFloat() / duration.toFloat()) * 100).toInt()
 50	 } else 0
 51	 view?.updateSeekBar(progress, 100)
 52	 }
 53	
 54	 override fun onSongChanged(song: Song?) {
 55	 song?.let {
 56	 currentSong = it
 57	 view?.showSongInfo(it)
 58	 }
 59	 }
 60	 })
 61	 musicServiceConnection?.connect()
 62	 }
 63	 
 64	 override fun initializePlayer(song: Song, playlist: List<Song>) {
 65	 Log.d(TAG, "initializePlayer called with song: ${song.title}, playlist size: ${playlist.size}")
 66	 this.currentSong = song
 67	 this.playlist = playlist
 68	 this.currentIndex = playlist.indexOf(song).takeIf { it >= 0 } ?: 0
 69	
 70	 Log.d(TAG, "Current index: $currentIndex")
 71	
 72	 view?.showSongInfo(song)
 73	 view?.updatePlaylist(playlist, currentIndex)
 74	 updateNavigationButtons()
 75	
 76	 // Start playing the song
 77	 Log.d(TAG, "Starting playback...")
 78	 musicServiceConnection?.playPlaylist(playlist, currentIndex)
 79	 }
 80	
 81	 override fun playPause() {
 82	 musicServiceConnection?.playPause()
 83	 }
 84	
 85	 override fun seekTo(position: Long) {
 86	 musicServiceConnection?.seekTo(position)
 87	 }

 139	 private fun playPlaylistInternal(songs: List<Song>, startIndex: Int = 0) {
 140	 Log.d(TAG, "playPlaylistInternal called with ${songs.size} songs, startIndex: $startIndex")
 141	 val mediaItems = MusicService.createMediaItems(songs)
 142	
 143	 // Log each media item for debugging
 144	 mediaItems.forEachIndexed { index, mediaItem ->
 145	 Log.d(TAG, "MediaItem $index: ${mediaItem.mediaId} - ${mediaItem.requestMetadata.mediaUri}")
 146	 }
 147	
 148	 mediaController?.let { controller ->
 149	 Log.d(TAG, "Setting media items and starting playback")
 150	 controller.setMediaItems(mediaItems, startIndex, 0)
 151	 controller.prepare()
 152	 controller.play()
 153	 Log.d(TAG, "Playback started")
 154	 } ?: Log.e(TAG, "MediaController is null, cannot play playlist")
 155	 }
 156	 
 157	 fun playPause() {
 158	 mediaController?.let { controller ->
 159	 if (controller.isPlaying) {
 160	 controller.pause()
 161	 } else {
 162	 controller.play()
 163	 }
 164	 }
 165	 }
 166	 
 167	 fun skipToNext() {
 168	 Log.d(TAG, "skipToNext called")
 169	 mediaController?.let { controller ->
 170	 if (controller.hasNextMediaItem()) {
 171	 controller.seekToNextMediaItem()
 172	 Log.d(TAG, "Skipped to next track")
 173	 } else {
 174	 Log.d(TAG, "No next track available")
 175	 }
 176	 } ?: Log.e(TAG, "MediaController is null, cannot skip to next")
 177	 }
 178	
 179	 fun skipToPrevious() {
 180	 Log.d(TAG, "skipToPrevious called")
 181	 mediaController?.let { controller ->
 182	 if (controller.hasPreviousMediaItem()) {
 183	 controller.seekToPreviousMediaItem()
 184	 Log.d(TAG, "Skipped to previous track")
 185	 } else {
 186	 Log.d(TAG, "No previous track available")
 187	 }
 188	 } ?: Log.e(TAG, "MediaController is null, cannot skip to previous")
 189	 }
 190	 
 191	 fun seekTo(position: Long) {
 192	 mediaController?.seekTo(position)
 193	 }
 194	 
 195	 fun isPlaying(): Boolean {
 196	 return mediaController?.isPlaying ?: false
 197	 }
 198	 
 199	 fun getCurrentPosition(): Long {
 200	 return mediaController?.currentPosition ?: 0L
 201	 }
 202	 
 203	 fun getDuration(): Long {
 204	 return mediaController?.duration ?: 0L
 205	 }

 11	import androidx.media3.common.Player

 17	import androidx.media3.session.MediaSessionService

 23	/**
 24	 * Background music service using ExoPlayer and MediaSession
 25	 * Handles audio playback, notifications, and media controls
 26	 */
 27	class MusicService : MediaSessionService() {
 28	
 29	 private var mediaSession: MediaSession? = null
 30	 private lateinit var player: ExoPlayer
 31	
 32	
 33	
 34	 override fun onCreate() {
 35	 super.onCreate()
 36	 Log.d(TAG, "MusicService onCreate")
 37	 initializePlayer()
 38	 initializeMediaSession()
 39	 }
 40	 
 41	 private fun initializePlayer() {
 42	 Log.d(TAG, "Initializing ExoPlayer")
 43	
 44	 // Create a custom HTTP data source factory with better error handling
 45	 val httpDataSourceFactory = DefaultHttpDataSource.Factory()
 46	 .setUserAgent("MusicPlayer/1.0")
 47	 .setConnectTimeoutMs(30000)
 48	 .setReadTimeoutMs(30000)
 49	 .setAllowCrossProtocolRedirects(true)
 50	
 51	 val mediaSourceFactory = DefaultMediaSourceFactory(this)
 52	 .setDataSourceFactory(httpDataSourceFactory)
 53	
 54	 player = ExoPlayer.Builder(this)
 55	 .setMediaSourceFactory(mediaSourceFactory)
 56	 .setAudioAttributes(
 57	 AudioAttributes.Builder()
 58	 .setContentType(C.AUDIO_CONTENT_TYPE_MUSIC)
 59	 .setUsage(C.USAGE_MEDIA)
 60	 .build(),
 61	 true
 62	 )
 63	 .setHandleAudioBecomingNoisy(true)
 64	 .build()
...
 78	
 79	 override fun onPlayerError(error: PlaybackException) {
 80	 Log.e(TAG, "Player error: ${error.message}", error)
 81	 Log.e(TAG, "Error code: ${error.errorCode}")
 82	 Log.e(TAG, "Error cause: ${error.cause?.message}")
 83	
 84	 // Try to recover from certain errors
 85	 when (error.errorCode) {
 86	 PlaybackException.ERROR_CODE_IO_NETWORK_CONNECTION_FAILED,
 87	 PlaybackException.ERROR_CODE_IO_NETWORK_CONNECTION_TIMEOUT -> {
 88	 Log.d(TAG, "Network error, attempting to retry...")
 89	 // Could implement retry logic here
 90	 }
 91	 PlaybackException.ERROR_CODE_PARSING_CONTAINER_MALFORMED,
 92	 PlaybackException.ERROR_CODE_PARSING_MANIFEST_MALFORMED -> {
 93	 Log.e(TAG, "Media format error, skipping to next track")
 94	 // Could skip to next track automatically
 95	 }
 96	 }
 97	 }
 98	 })
 99	 }
 100	 
 101	 private fun initializeMediaSession() {
 102	 val sessionActivityPendingIntent = PendingIntent.getActivity(
 103	 this,
 104	 0,
 105	 Intent(this, MainActivity::class.java),
 106	 PendingIntent.FLAG_IMMUTABLE
 107	 )
 108	 
 109	 mediaSession = MediaSession.Builder(this, player)
 110	 .setSessionActivity(sessionActivityPendingIntent)
 111	 .setCallback(MediaSessionCallback())
 112	 .build()
 113	 }
 114	 
 115	 override fun onGetSession(controllerInfo: MediaSession.ControllerInfo): MediaSession? {
 116	 return mediaSession
 117	 }
 118	 
 119	 override fun onDestroy() {
 120	 mediaSession?.run {
 121	 player.release()
 122	 release()
 123	 mediaSession = null
 124	 }
 125	 super.onDestroy()
 126	 }
 127	 
 128	 /**
 129	 * Custom MediaSession callback to handle media commands
 130	 */
 131	 private inner class MediaSessionCallback : MediaSession.Callback {
 132	
 133	 override fun onAddMediaItems(
 134	 mediaSession: MediaSession,
 135	 controller: MediaSession.ControllerInfo,
 136	 mediaItems: MutableList<MediaItem>
 137	 ): ListenableFuture<MutableList<MediaItem>> {
 138	 val updatedMediaItems = mediaItems.map { mediaItem ->
 139	 mediaItem.buildUpon()
 140	 .setUri(mediaItem.requestMetadata.mediaUri)
 141	 .build()
 142	 }.toMutableList()
 143	 return Futures.immediateFuture(updatedMediaItems)
 144	 }
 145	 }

 72	
 73	The app includes 7 sample songs:
 74	1. **"12600 lettres (Dbat)"** - Franco & TP OK Jazz
 75	2. **"Again & Again"** - Usatof
 76	3. **"Ain't No Mountain High Enough"** - Marvin Gaye & Tammi Terrell
 77	4. **"All I Have to Do Is Dream"** - The Everly Brothers
 78	5. **"All Night"** - Siddy Ranks
 79	6. **"Escape (The Pia Colada Song)"** - Rupert Holmes
 80	7. **"September"** - Earth, Wind & Fire
 81	
 82	All songs use SoundHelix demo tracks for testing.
 83	
 84	## Technical Details
 85	
 86	### Architecture:
 87	- **MVP Pattern**: Clean separation of concerns
 88	- **ExoPlayer**: Professional audio streaming
 89	- **MediaSession**: System integration for media controls
 90	- **Background Service**: Continues playback when app is minimized
 91	
 92	### Key Components:
 93	- `MusicService`: Background audio service
 94	- `MusicServiceConnection`: Service binding and communication
 95	- `PlayerPresenter`: Business logic for playback
 96	- `PlayerActivity`: Full-screen player UI
 97	
 98	## Troubleshooting
 99	
 100	### If Music Doesn't Play:
 101	1. **Check Internet Connection**: Songs stream from online URLs
 102	2. **Check Audio Permissions**: Ensure app has audio permissions
 103	3. **Check Device Volume**: Make sure media volume is up
 104	4. **Check Logs**: Look for ExoPlayer errors in logcat
 105	
 106	### Common Issues:
 107	- **Network Error**: Check if URLs are accessible
 108	- **Permission Denied**: Ensure all audio permissions granted
 109	- **Service Not Starting**: Check AndroidManifest service registration
 110

 34	 override fun loadSongs() {
 35	 view?.showLoading()
 36	 
 37	 presenterScope.launch {
 38	 try {
 39	 val result = repository.getAllSongs()
 40	 
 41	 withContext(Dispatchers.Main) {
 42	 view?.hideLoading()
 43	 
 44	 result.fold(
 45	 onSuccess = { songs ->
 46	 currentSongs = songs
 47	 if (songs.isEmpty()) {
 48	 view?.showEmptyState()
 49	 } else {
 50	 view?.showSongs(songs)
 51	 }
 52	 },
 53	 onFailure = { exception ->
 54	 view?.showError(exception.message ?: "Failed to load songs")
 55	 }
 56	 )
 57	 }
 58	 } catch (e: Exception) {
 59	 withContext(Dispatchers.Main) {
 60	 view?.hideLoading()
 61	 view?.showError(e.message ?: "An unexpected error occurred")
 62	 }
 63	 }
 64	 }
 65	 }
 66	 
 67	 override fun onSongClicked(song: Song, playlist: List<Song>) {
 68	 view?.navigateToPlayer(song, playlist)
 69	 }

 1	package com.nauh.musicplayer.data.model
 2	
 3	import android.os.Parcelable
 4	import kotlinx.parcelize.Parcelize
 5	
 6	/**
 7	 * Data model representing a song with all necessary information for streaming
 8	 */
 9	@Parcelize
 10	data class Song(
 11	 val id: String,
 12	 val title: String,
 13	 val artist: String,
 14	 val album: String,
 15	 val duration: Long, // Duration in milliseconds
 16	 val artworkUrl: String,
 17	 val streamUrl: String,
 18	 val genre: String? = null,
 19	 val releaseYear: Int? = null,
 20	 val trackNumber: Int? = null
 21	) : Parcelable {
 22	 
 23	 /**
 24	 * Returns formatted duration string (mm:ss)
 25	 */
 26	 fun getFormattedDuration(): String {
 27	 val minutes = (duration / 1000) / 60
 28	 val seconds = (duration / 1000) % 60
 29	 return String.format("%02d:%02d", minutes, seconds)
 30	 }
 31	 
 32	 /**
 33	 * Returns display text for artist and album
 34	 */
 35	 fun getArtistAlbumText(): String {
 36	 return "$artist $album"
 37	 }
 38	}

 37	 private fun initializeMusicService() {
 38	 musicServiceConnection = MusicServiceConnection(context)
 39	 musicServiceConnection?.setPlaybackStateListener(object : MusicServiceConnection.PlaybackStateListener {
 40	 override fun onPlaybackStateChanged(isPlaying: Boolean) {
 41	 view?.updatePlayPauseButton(isPlaying)
 42	 }
 43	
 44	 override fun onProgressUpdate(position: Long, duration: Long) {
 45	 view?.updateProgress(position, duration)
 46	
 47	 // Update seek bar
 48	 val progress = if (duration > 0) {
 49	 ((position.toFloat() / duration.toFloat()) * 100).toInt()
 50	 } else 0
 51	 view?.updateSeekBar(progress, 100)
 52	 }
 53	
 54	 override fun onSongChanged(song: Song?) {
 55	 song?.let {
 56	 currentSong = it
 57	 view?.showSongInfo(it)
 58	 }
 59	 }
 60	 })
 61	 musicServiceConnection?.connect()
 62	 }
 63	 
 64	 override fun initializePlayer(song: Song, playlist: List<Song>) {
 65	 Log.d(TAG, "initializePlayer called with song: ${song.title}, playlist size: ${playlist.size}")
 66	 this.currentSong = song
 67	 this.playlist = playlist
 68	 this.currentIndex = playlist.indexOf(song).takeIf { it >= 0 } ?: 0
 69	
 70	 Log.d(TAG, "Current index: $currentIndex")
 71	
 72	 view?.showSongInfo(song)
 73	 view?.updatePlaylist(playlist, currentIndex)
 74	 updateNavigationButtons()
 75	
 76	 // Start playing the song
 77	 Log.d(TAG, "Starting playback...")
 78	 musicServiceConnection?.playPlaylist(playlist, currentIndex)
 79	 }
 80	
 81	 override fun playPause() {
 82	 musicServiceConnection?.playPause()
 83	 }
 84	
 85	 override fun seekTo(position: Long) {
 86	 musicServiceConnection?.seekTo(position)
 87	 }
 88	 
 89	 override fun skipToNext() {
 90	 if (currentIndex < playlist.size - 1) {
 91	 currentIndex++
 92	 currentSong = playlist[currentIndex]
 93	 view?.showSongInfo(currentSong!!)
 94	 }
 95	 musicServiceConnection?.skipToNext()
 96	 updateNavigationButtons()
 97	 }
 98	
 99	 override fun skipToPrevious() {
 100	 if (currentIndex > 0) {
 101	 currentIndex--
 102	 currentSong = playlist[currentIndex]
 103	 view?.showSongInfo(currentSong!!)
 104	 }
 105	 musicServiceConnection?.skipToPrevious()
 106	 updateNavigationButtons()
 107	 }
 108	 
 109	 override fun toggleShuffle() {
 110	 isShuffled = !isShuffled
 111	 view?.showShuffleState(isShuffled)
 112	 updateNavigationButtons()
 113	 }
...

 140	 override fun onSongChanged(song: Song) {
 141	 currentSong = song
 142	 view?.showSongInfo(song)
 143	 }
 144	 
 145	 override fun onPlaylistChanged(songs: List<Song>, currentIndex: Int) {
 146	 this.playlist = songs
 147	 this.currentIndex = currentIndex
 148	 view?.updatePlaylist(songs, currentIndex)
 149	 updateNavigationButtons()
 150	 }
 151	 
 152	 private fun updateNavigationButtons() {
 153	 val canGoPrevious = when {
 154	 isShuffled -> playlist.size > 1
 155	 repeatMode == PlayerContract.RepeatMode.ALL -> playlist.size > 1
 156	 else -> currentIndex > 0
 157	 }
 158	 
 159	 val canGoNext = when {
 160	 isShuffled -> playlist.size > 1
 161	 repeatMode == PlayerContract.RepeatMode.ALL -> playlist.size > 1
 162	 else -> currentIndex < playlist.size - 1
 163	 }
 164	 
 165	 view?.enablePreviousButton(canGoPrevious)
 166	 view?.enableNextButton(canGoNext)
 167	 }
 168	}

 23	/**
 24	 * Background music service using ExoPlayer and MediaSession
 25	 * Handles audio playback, notifications, and media controls
 26	 */
 27	class MusicService : MediaSessionService() {
 28	
 29	 private var mediaSession: MediaSession? = null
 30	 private lateinit var player: ExoPlayer
 31	
 32	
 33	
 34	 override fun onCreate() {
 35	 super.onCreate()
 36	 Log.d(TAG, "MusicService onCreate")
 37	 initializePlayer()
 38	 initializeMediaSession()
 39	 }
 40	 
 41	 private fun initializePlayer() {
 42	 Log.d(TAG, "Initializing ExoPlayer")
 43	
 44	 // Create a custom HTTP data source factory with better error handling
 45	 val httpDataSourceFactory = DefaultHttpDataSource.Factory()
 46	 .setUserAgent("MusicPlayer/1.0")
 47	 .setConnectTimeoutMs(30000)
 48	 .setReadTimeoutMs(30000)
 49	 .setAllowCrossProtocolRedirects(true)
 50	
 51	 val mediaSourceFactory = DefaultMediaSourceFactory(this)
 52	 .setDataSourceFactory(httpDataSourceFactory)
 53	
 54	 player = ExoPlayer.Builder(this)
 55	 .setMediaSourceFactory(mediaSourceFactory)
 56	 .setAudioAttributes(
 57	 AudioAttributes.Builder()
 58	 .setContentType(C.AUDIO_CONTENT_TYPE_MUSIC)
 59	 .setUsage(C.USAGE_MEDIA)
 60	 .build(),
 61	 true
 62	 )
 63	 .setHandleAudioBecomingNoisy(true)
 64	 .build()

 78	
 79	 override fun onPlayerError(error: PlaybackException) {
 80	 Log.e(TAG, "Player error: ${error.message}", error)
 81	 Log.e(TAG, "Error code: ${error.errorCode}")
 82	 Log.e(TAG, "Error cause: ${error.cause?.message}")
 83	
 84	 // Try to recover from certain errors
 85	 when (error.errorCode) {
 86	 PlaybackException.ERROR_CODE_IO_NETWORK_CONNECTION_FAILED,
 87	 PlaybackException.ERROR_CODE_IO_NETWORK_CONNECTION_TIMEOUT -> {
 88	 Log.d(TAG, "Network error, attempting to retry...")
 89	 // Could implement retry logic here
 90	 }
 91	 PlaybackException.ERROR_CODE_PARSING_CONTAINER_MALFORMED,
 92	 PlaybackException.ERROR_CODE_PARSING_MANIFEST_MALFORMED -> {
 93	 Log.e(TAG, "Media format error, skipping to next track")
 94	 // Could skip to next track automatically
 95	 }
 96	 }
 97	 }
 98	 })
 99	 }

 50	 override fun onCreate(savedInstanceState: Bundle?) {
 51	 super.onCreate(savedInstanceState)
 52	 setContentView(R.layout.activity_player)
 53	 
 54	 initializeViews()
 55	 setupToolbar()
 56	 setupSeekBar()
 57	 initializePresenter()
 58	 
 59	 // Get song and playlist from intent
 60	 val song = if (android.os.Build.VERSION.SDK_INT >= android.os.Build.VERSION_CODES.TIRAMISU) {
 61	 intent.getParcelableExtra(EXTRA_SONG, Song::class.java)
 62	 } else {
 63	 @Suppress("DEPRECATION")
 64	 intent.getParcelableExtra<Song>(EXTRA_SONG)
 65	 }
 66	
 67	 val playlist = if (android.os.Build.VERSION.SDK_INT >= android.os.Build.VERSION_CODES.TIRAMISU) {
 68	 intent.getParcelableArrayListExtra(EXTRA_PLAYLIST, Song::class.java) ?: emptyList()
 69	 } else {
 70	 @Suppress("DEPRECATION")
 71	 intent.getParcelableArrayListExtra<Song>(EXTRA_PLAYLIST) ?: emptyList()
 72	 }
 73	 
 74	 if (song != null) {
 75	 presenter.initializePlayer(song, playlist)
 76	 } else {
 77	 finish() // Close activity if no song provided
 78	 }
 79	 }
 80	
 81	 private fun initializeViews() {
 82	 toolbar = findViewById(R.id.playerToolbar)
 83	 albumArtwork = findViewById(R.id.playerAlbumArtwork)
 84	 songTitle = findViewById(R.id.playerSongTitle)
 85	 artistName = findViewById(R.id.playerArtistName)
 86	 albumName = findViewById(R.id.playerAlbumName)
 87	 seekBar = findViewById(R.id.seekBar)
 88	 currentTime = findViewById(R.id.currentTime)
 89	 totalTime = findViewById(R.id.totalTime)
 90	 playPauseButton = findViewById(R.id.playPauseButton)
 91	 previousButton = findViewById(R.id.previousButton)
 92	 nextButton = findViewById(R.id.nextButton)
 93	 shuffleButton = findViewById(R.id.shuffleButton)
 94	 repeatButton = findViewById(R.id.repeatButton)
 95	 progressBar = findViewById(R.id.playerProgressBar)
 96	 }
 97

 99	 setSupportActionBar(toolbar)
 100	 supportActionBar?.setDisplayHomeAsUpEnabled(true)

 163	 /**

 165	 */
 166	 fun createMediaItem(song: Song): MediaItem {
 167	 Log.d(TAG, "Creating MediaItem for song: ${song.title}, URL: ${song.streamUrl}")
 168	
 169	 val metadata = MediaMetadata.Builder()
 170	 .setTitle(song.title)
 171	 .setArtist(song.artist)
 172	 .setAlbumTitle(song.album)
 173	 .setArtworkUri(android.net.Uri.parse(song.artworkUrl))
 174	 .build()
 175	
 176	 val mediaItem = MediaItem.Builder()
 177	 .setUri(song.streamUrl)
 178	 .setMediaId(song.id)
 179	 .setMediaMetadata(metadata)
 180	 .build()
 181	
 182	 Log.d(TAG, "MediaItem created with URI: ${mediaItem.localConfiguration?.uri}")
 183	 return mediaItem
 184	 }

 85	 override fun onMediaItemTransition(mediaItem: MediaItem?, reason: Int) {

 89	 // Convert MediaItem back to Song if needed

 91	 }

 100	 Log.d(TAG, "Playing pending playlist")
 101	 playPlaylistInternal(songs, startIndex)
 102	 pendingPlaylist = null
 103	 }
 104	
 105	 } catch (e: Exception) {
 106	 Log.e(TAG, "Error connecting MediaController", e)
 107	 e.printStackTrace()
 108	 }
 109	 }, MoreExecutors.directExecutor())
 110	 }
